website_summaries.verdict: This classic boar-bristle pastry brush is made in Germany by a reputable brush manufacturer.
pros: Brush made of natural boar bristles
Natural boar bristles hold liquid smoothly to help spread it
Hand wash and gently dry with a cotton towel
Bristles are folded over so they won't fall out
Lets you get in narrow spaces
cons: Hairs can fall out into food

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after just a few uses. I've bought brushes similar to these that lasted years, but these are such poor construction. the glue used is water soluble and these brushes are not washable.
customer_reviews.author: Debra W

customer_reviews.title: Low quality and hazardous around food
customer_reviews.text: The metal part rusted after a few uses. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: mari

customer_reviews.title: Don't particularly like the thin, flat handles but the bristles are good
customer_reviews.text: I like the brush bristles. What I didn't realize is that the handles are very flat and thin and not the most comfortable to use. I prefer either round handles or at the very least fatter handles than these brushes have. I'm not bothering to send them back but in the future I will be more careful when reading the description for the shape and size of the handles
customer_reviews.author: Dee Brown

customer_reviews.title: Does not withstand the heat
customer_reviews.text: Bristles burn in the pan, you need to buy one that withstands the heat, this one does not!
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: each time i use these they loose hair and dont' keep their shape
customer_reviews.author: alwaysachance

customer_reviews.title: Essential Baking Tool
customer_reviews.text: I’m a serious baker and having the proper tool is essential. I’m always concerned that egg washing breads and rolls may deflate the dough. The bristles on these brushes are soft, gentle and very pliable. I’ve used them several times now. The rolls and breads have turned out with beautiful rise and finish. People are totally impressed that I make these better than commercial products. Cleaning is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The best pastry brushes I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these pastry brushes for about two years, and use them about once a week. Amazingly enough, only about 3 bristle hairs have fallen out the whole time. These brushes apply butter to pans and egg wash on baked goods very smoothly and evenly--much better than any silicone brush. Definitely a must-have for any baker! I've been careful to keep the brushes out of standing water, so the metal band hasn't rusted at all. They're easy to clean with a squirt of dish soap and hot water. Air-drying them works well. Overall, an excellent product that I recommend and would definitely buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke T.

customer_reviews.title: Ten-Star Quality Pastry Brushes!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pastry brushes! Made in Germany, quality made natural bristles on beechwood handles; the metal retainer that binds the brushes to the quality handles is steel, and I can store these on my magnetic kitchen toolbar so they are handy and at-hand at a moment's notice. I am definitely buying these again, and giving them as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Brush it off.
customer_reviews.text: Not convinced that these were real Redecker brushes. I own several, I love Reddecker, but these brushes are poorly made and don't have the professional craftsmanship and gentle rustic touch that other Redecker brushes have. Could have bought these at the dollar store and saved myself some money and tears! Just sayin'!
customer_reviews.author: NotYourPanda

customer_reviews.title: No more plastic in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Since plastic utensils and toothbrushes are some of the worst environmental polluters, I'm converting to an all-natural kitchen and bathroom accessories. This brush is beautifully made and biodegradable.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: I typically use silicone brushes during basting and cooking, but needed more adhesion for a thin syrup during baking. These are great, don't shed, not as easy to clean with natural fibers but it worked very well for what I needed. Delivered quickly and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Miyamoto

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I love that these are not plastic. They're easy to use and I wash them in warm water after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Good balance for a pastry brush
customer_reviews.text: The boar hair has the right softness, so it don’t affect the shape of the pastry (I made mooncakes that has molded imprints that are delicate), and at the same time, is stiff enough so it picks up and delivers the right amount of egg wash.
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great Pastry Brushes!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these pastry brushes. I am not a fan of the new silicone brushes, so these natural brushes are perfect for me. Easy to use and clean and hold their bristles well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scam! Cheaply made, super thin and flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cheaply made, these brushes are very thin and flimsy. What looks like regular pastry brushes in the photos are actually only about an eighth of an inch thick, with not much in the way of bristles. I will not be surprised if they disintegrate at the first use: they're held together with two meager staples. Definitely not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Small but great quality
customer_reviews.text: These brushes are really cute. But super tiny. Medium stiff bristle. I should have looked at the size. They are nice tho. Really good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Good Values
customer_reviews.text: So hard to find decent brushes in local stores. Its great to use the web to find quality products
customer_reviews.author: JERRY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size basting brush
customer_reviews.text: These brushed seem to be of a good quality and are what I was looking for in a natural bristle and small. I didn't need a 3 or 4 inch brush. I was looking for a 1/2 inch and the smaller one is just right.
customer_reviews.author: katydid

customer_reviews.title: Best pastry brish I ever used
customer_reviews.text: When I saw it is made in Germany, I was so interested of it. When I received it. I was so surprised how glad the quality was by just touching it
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Ho

customer_reviews.title: Not losing bristles!
customer_reviews.text: I love those pastry brushes. They work great, are easy to clean, and haven't lost a hair yet. I have used them 6-7 times since I've gotten them. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: ELKE ALTMAN

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot one can say about a tool like this. They work fine, seem to be of good quality and the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: BillHilton

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I've recently begun baking "fancy" pastries and wanted a "real" pastry brush for egg washes, etc. These are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I used both brushes multiple times now and neither one has lost a single bristle. They are the perfect size for baking and making pastries. I hand-washed, rinsed and dried them with a paper towel. I'm not sure how they will hold up long term with rust, etc. as some reviewers have mentioned. Definitely a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Redecker Pastry Brushes Good Size for Women
customer_reviews.text: Redecker Pastry Brushes are standard bristle brushes and good small sizes for smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: Cali Native

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these before, they hold up for a long time. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Texan2

customer_reviews.title: it cams quickly and I am very satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time last night, brushing butter on bread. It didn't clump up and the bristles stayed on. I will update later if any problems occur but as of right now, it cams quickly and I am very satisfied with my purchase. 10/23/2016
customer_reviews.author: Cha'kwaina

customer_reviews.title: GOOD VALUE FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: There are great in the kitchen for basting meat and veggies. I have one for BBQ sauce and another for bacon fat to brush on certain veggies that are going into the air-fryer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Pastry Brushes
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a timely manner. Brushes are sturdy and have not released any "hair" when using.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only bristle brushes like this I could find, thank good they are German and of good quality!
customer_reviews.author: junglepig

customer_reviews.title: A very nice set of brushes
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice set of brushes. They are well constructed, so that the bristles are unlikely to come loose. I use it to spread ghee on things and it works quite well; cleans very easily, too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bodenstedt

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Work very well for the price. Easily would have paid twice as much for the same brush set in the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Crystle

customer_reviews.title: Nice pastry brush.
customer_reviews.text: It's really nice to have a pastry brush that keeps it bristles in the brush. This brush works very well but the handles are unfinished. I would still recommend these pastry brushes.
customer_reviews.author: loves2read

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Value was great but durability was so so hairs fell out to fast thru away after 2 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ole Sarge

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Oroduct
customer_reviews.text: Just used the one thus far, and was happy with the brush!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine M.

customer_reviews.title: Old Time Favorite
customer_reviews.text: These are what my grandma, mom and I have used for years. Have tried newer items but they don't compare to the originals. If it ain't broke, don't fix it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My use
customer_reviews.text: I use a spray on my bundt pan and use the brush to spread it evenly. This brush works the best for this. I tried to nylon brush and it's too stiff and leaves places without the spray.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmom

customer_reviews.title: Bristles fall out and stick to dough
customer_reviews.text: I used this brush to apply an egg wash to loaves of bread before they went in the oven. Fine bristles fell out and stuck to the bread. I was able to carefully remove them without deflating the dough, but I won't be using them again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Pastery Brushes Rock
customer_reviews.text: I liked that they spread the butter easily and the hairs did not fall out. Clean up was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Harold G.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the bigger one so far, but it works exactly like it is supposed to. No issues so far. I've mostly used it to butter some ramekins and spread out a layer of olive oil on dough.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. More effective than the silicone brush I had.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A. Leonardi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Baking!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time last night and it was perfect for my needs! If they had longer handles, my husband could use them when he's grilling!

customer_reviews.title: They appeared to be of quality.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift - so waiting for feedback from recipient.

customer_reviews.text: I've owned these pastry brushes for about two years, and use them about once a week. Amazingly enough, only about 3 bristle hairs have fallen out the whole time.

customer_reviews.text: The wooden handle is just a little bit thinner that I thought it would be but otherwise it is as expected.

customer_reviews.text: The bristles are fabulous but the metal securing the bristles rusts really easily. Next!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: I love these pastry brushes. They are so versatile that I even use them for my craft painting in addition to basting food. I have reordered them several times.

customer_reviews.title: German quality !!!
customer_reviews.text: I really do love these pastry brushes. They are just right. No bristles left in the pastry. Just the right "touch" to cover the pastry with egg whites or olive oil. Clean nicely.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality brushes

I expected a high quality brush, that can hold it's pieces together, specially for the price, but to my dismay, within 15 minutes of work, I had to pick 4 or 5 pieces of the bush out of my chocolate and icing.....so, great name not so great brush

customer_reviews.text: I love the quality of these brushes! I use pastry brushes regularly and am picky about their construction. These brushes are tight enough to move whatever liquid I am using yet, loose enough to clean up easily. They are a good buy!

customer_reviews.title: These are great! They work well to paint pie crusts with ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They work well to paint pie crusts with egg wash and look super cute if they're just laying around. And, let's be honest here, all I want from life are pretty and useful things. If you like to bake - buy them!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: If you are starting out or a long time baker, this is a great addition to any cooking collection. I like this as they clean up well. I have never been amused when cleaning pastry brushes the oil is so hard to clean. These seem to be very easy to use and I would buy them again. Price is right!

customer_reviews.title: Brushed wash good and they work
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected, but they are okay. Brushed wash good and they work. The length posted is the entire length, not the handle length. I was wanting a little longer brush.

customer_reviews.text: They work great for everything from brushing butter on layers of phyllo dough to basting meat on the grill. The natural bristles clean up well with a tiny bit of dish soap.

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good basic pastry brushes that look like they won't pull apart for awhile! I like the boar bristles so much more than the silicone brushes now so popular. Handles are a bit thin but nothing to stop me from enjoying using them.

customer_reviews.title: LOVEE!
customer_reviews.text: These are soo cute & look great in my chef kit, definately recommend if you like the rustic feel, bravo!

customer_reviews.title: Go to your paint store or quality Big Box store for Boar Bristle brushes at 1/5 the price for the best, wash under running water
customer_reviews.text: These two brushes are just barely OKAY, no where near the quality and (brush thickness and handle sturdiness) as those I bought a few years ago at a popular Kitchen Specialty Store [W.S.] a couple of years ago. They will 'do', but I'm giving them a "meh"... for sturdiness and quality. Probably won't reorder. Go to your paint store or quality Big Box store for Boar Bristle brushes at 1/5 the price for the best, wash under running water, then air dry after each use. Then enjoy them for years to come. --From a long time accomplished cook and baker.
customer_reviews.author: Lolly M

customer_reviews.title: Dont recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Very very cheap! The head is falling off, the 'hair' is all over the food. Dont recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina.R.

customer_reviews.title: My flour removal buddy
customer_reviews.text: I use this brush to remove excess flour from loaves of bread prior to baking. The stiff bristles are ideal for loosening flour from loaves quickly and efficiently. Any flour that remains in the brush is easily shaken out.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Clymer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kitchen brush!!
customer_reviews.text: This brush turned out to be the perfect size with high quality bristles. I have been told that some of the best brushes come from Germany, so I purchased it, now I believe it!

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied. They are like cheap paint brushes. The small one is like a $.25 paint brush you can buy at Lowe's.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Love my new brushes
customer_reviews.text: Finally able to find wood *and* bristles, not those cheap plastic "brushes" with those horrendous silicone flappy things they call bristles. Love my new brushes!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Baron

customer_reviews.title: What a pastry brush should be.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good duo for me. Right size and bristles are not so stiff they gouge the pastry. Happy with my purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality - rust and mold after 1st use.
customer_reviews.text: Rusted after 1st use. And already showing signs of mold on handle.

product_meta.title: Redecker Pastry Brushes with Untreated Beechwood Handles, Set of 2, Multi-purpose Brushes with Natural Boar Bristles for Basting, Glazing and More, 7-1/2 inches and 8 inches, Made in Germany
product_meta.description:
Color:Untreated Beechwood Handle, Set of 2

A set of 2 pastry brushes for all your cooking and baking needs

Ideal for glazing, basting, spreading sauces, icing pastries or cakes, making candy and greasing pans with oil or melted butter, the Redecker Pastry Brushes with Untreated Beechwood Handles is a highly-versatile kitchen tool set. Soft and flexible natural boar bristles properly absorb liquids for easy application and promote smooth and effortless spreading. Great for applying egg washes, sugar glazes and flavorful spice mixes to fish, meat, pastries, cakes and other baked goods. Easy-to-grip handle made from beautiful handcrafted beechwood with a steel joint between the handle and bristle for durability and lasting quality. The wood is untreated and color will vary somewhat from product image due to natural variations in the wood. Comes with 2 pastry brushes sized 7-1/2" and 8" ideal for a wide range of cooking and baking tasks. To clean, handwash then gently dry with a cotton towel. Not safe for dishwasher.

The first handcrafted Bürstenhaus Redecker brushes were produced in 1935. A lot has changed since then. Today, the name Bürstenhaus Redecker stands as it has for many years for an ideal combination of natural quality, function and design. It lives from the blend of inventiveness, sound craftsmanship and creativity. Handcrafted in Germany, Bürstenhaus Redecker brushes are made of domestic woods, bristles, hair, and plant fibers, and have been for decades. Precedence is given to natural, sustainable raw materials.
feature_bullets: VERSATILE BAKING TOOL: Great for glazing, basting and spreading sauces; also useful for icing pastries or cakes, making candy and greasing pans with oil or melted butter
NATURAL BOAR BRISTLES: Soft and flexible boar bristles promote smooth and effortless spreading; liquids adhere to natural bristles for easy application

BEAUTIFUL HANDCRAFTED BEECHWOOD: Untreated beechwood handle will vary somewhat from the product image due to natural color of the wood; produced by world-renowned Bürstenhaus Redecker, a German company that has been handcrafting brushes since 1935
SET OF 2: Brush set of 2 includes 7-1/2" pastry brush and 8" pastry brush; great for a variety of baking endeavors
CARE: Handwash to clean then gently dry with a cotton towel; not safe for dishwasher; made in Germany

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars369 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
